DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate effectiveness two dos carbetocin ( 50 mcg v 100 mcg ) prevent uterine atony elective cesarean section .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Two Doses Carbetocin Prevention Uterine Atony , During Elective Cesarean Section
DOC.detailed_description: Postpartum hemorrhage major cause mortality morbidity world , often cause uterine atony . To prevent complication , uterotonic medication use elective cesarean section . Carbetocin , long-acting synthetic analogue oxytocin , use purpose many year . This medication numerous side effect : hypotension , tachycardia , nausea , vomit , chest pain , etc . Using small dose carbetocin might lower incidence side effect , without compromise prevention uterine atony low-risk group patient .
DOC.criteria: ≥ 18 year old ≥ 37week pregnancy singleton pregnancy elective cesarean section low transverse incision ASA I II Personal history uterine atony postpartum hemorrhage Abnormal placental implantation ( know suspect ) > 3 cesarean section past Personal history classic uterine incision Estimated fetal weight > 4500g Hemoglobin < 100 g/L Regular use tocolytic drug Cesarean section general anesthesia Known allergy carbetocin Refusal Inability obtain informed consent
